text:
The A's made a special baseball card for a young fan Email Print By Adrian Garro | 
Some of the baseball-playing children of today will grow up to be the stars of tomorrow. That's just how things work. 
Recently, a father sent the A's a precious photo of his young son, fully decked out in green and gold, with a question about their Spring Training roster: . @Athletics Can you check with Melvin to see if he needs a utility toddler for #springtraining roster? pic.twitter.com/gTExSBgDbg - Jon Manuel (@JonManuel) February 17, 2017 
... and the A's, eager to make this dad's day, replied in amazing fashion: . @JonManuel We checked with BoMel and there's some definite interest. First kindergarten, then the big leagues. #RootedInOakland pic.twitter.com/C9PzdRYryr - Oakland A's ����⚾️ (@Athletics) February 18, 2017 
A message from BoMel, a unique baseball card design and a promise of a roster spot in a few years? This kid's got the buzz. - Oakland A's ����⚾️ (@Athletics) February 18, 2017 This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs. more from cut4
